section.title: Overview
section.para: The module exports utility functions based on libruxc.
Among them are function to perform HTTP GET and POST queries.
The ruxc project is available at: https://github.com/miconda/ruxc.

section.title: &kamailio; Modules
section.para:
The following modules must be installed (but not loaded) to use this module:
none.

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para:
The following libraries or applications must be installed before running &kamailio; with this module loaded:
libruxc.

section.title: http_timeout (int)
section.para: The interval in miliseconds after which the HTTP GET or POST query times out.

section.title: http_tlsmode (int)
section.para: The mode to connect over TLS to HTTPS sites: 0 accept all certificates; 1 - accept trusted certificates.

Perform a HTTP GET request to "url", storing the response body in the "respv" variable. The "hdrs" can be empty string to skip setting them. The first two parameters can contain variables that are evaluated at runtime. The "respv" has to be the name of a writable variable.
The function returns response code of HTTP reply or negative value if something went wrong.
This function can be used from ANY_ROUTE.

Perform a HTTP POST request to "url", storing the response body in the "respv" variable. The "body" and "hdrs" can be empty strings to skip setting them. The first three parameters can contain variables that are evaluated at runtime. The "respv" has to be the name of a writable variable.
The function returns response code of HTTP reply or negative value if something went wrong.
This function can be used from ANY_ROUTE.

section.title: Installation
section.para: The module needs "libruxc" library, which is provided by "ruxc" project from https://github.com/miconda/ruxc/. The library is implemented in Rust language, with generated C API and library. Until the libruxc is going to be packaged in OS distributions, the ruxc module can be compiled by copying ruxc.h and libruxc.a files in the folder of the module.
To generate the libruxc.a file, it requires to have Rust language installed and its environment configured, then run the following commands:

example.title: Libruxc Usage
example.programlisting:
... git clone https://github.com/miconda/ruxc cd ruxc cargo build --release cp include/ruxc.h target/release/libruxc.a \ /path/to/kamailio/src/modules/ruxc/
cd /path/to/kamailio/ make include_modules="ruxc ..." cfg make all make install
## or compiling individual module for use inside source tree # make modules modules=src/modules/ruxc ...

section.para: For more details about compilation and installation of libruxc, see: https://github.com/miconda/ruxc.
